If you are not satisfied with our product, then simply send us an email and we will refund your purchase right away. Our goal has always been to create a happy, thriving community. If you are not thrilled with the product or are not enjoying the experience, then we have no interest in forcing you to stay an unhappy member.[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle admin_label="Toggle" title="What are Photoshop Files?" open="off"]Elegant Themes offers two different packages: Personal and Developer. The Personal Subscription is ideal for the average user while the Developers License is meant for experienced designers who wish to customize their themes using the original Photoshop files. Photoshop files are the original design files that were used to create the theme. They can be opened using Adobe Photoshop and edited, and prove very useful for customers wishing to change their theme's design in some way.[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle admin_label="Toggle" title="Can I upgrade after signing up?" open="off"]Yes, you can upgrade at any time after signing up. When you log in as a "personal" subscriber, you will see a notice regarding your current package and instructions on how to upgrade.[/et_pb_toggle][et_pb_toggle admin_label="Toggle" title="Can I use your themes with WP.com?" open="off"]Unfortunately WordPress.com does not allow the use of custom themes. If you would like to use a custom theme of any kind, you will need to purchase your own hosting account and install the free software from WordPress.org. Advanced Drag & Drop Builder

The Divi Builder was made with user experience at the forefront of its priorities. Your editing controls are pulled out of the main content area so that you get a clear and concise representation of how your modules fit into your page layout.[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_image admin_label="Image" src="https://elegantthemesimages.com/images/premade/d2-placeholder-1080px.jpg" url_new_window="off" animation="right" show_in_lightbox="off" /][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fullwidth="on" specialty="off" inner_shadow="off" parallax="on" module_id="backgrounds"][et_pb_fullwidth_slider admin_label="Fullwidth Slider" show_arrows="on" show_pagination="on" auto="off" parallax="off"][et_pb_slide heading="All The Right Things" background_color="#ffffff" alignment="center" background_layout="dark" background_image="https://elegantthemesimages.com/images/premade/d2-placeholder-1920.png"]Vestibulum lobortis. Fully Responsive Layouts

item.dc:creator: Trevor272
item.content:encoded:
WHY MINTAGE MINING?

Mintage Miningoffers all of the elements that are desirable in a mining platform package with basically none of the elements that arent. Instead of a mining pool, Mintage mining is a miningplatform;. That is, they offer the ability for non-techies and non-miners to get involved in mining with none of the upfront investment in time, equipment or education. They are also able to coordinate with multiple mining pools and to leverage the best offers in a way that brings the most value to those who buy in to the weekly contracts. You could think of them as a brokerage which is able to coordinate among various offers and expertly negotiate the most profitable deals. They make the tough decisions, you simply give what you can to the operation. Essentially, mining pools need funding. Without it, they would soon go belly up. Mining isexpensive.And it is becoming increasingly more so all the time.The electricity costs alone would put most people off the idea altogether. There also considerable costs involved for competitive hardware, maintanance, skilled technicians on top of the sheer amount of time required to run a profitable mining operation; to be competitive, a mining operation must run 24/7 to ensure optimum efficiency and profitability. All the while there is the risk of malfunction or systems going down altogether. Unless you have the technical skill and human capital to manage this type of situation, this is probably a risk you dont want to take. What Mintage is able to do is offer the mining pools it works with pure capital (Show me the money!). There is nothing a business with high overhead needs more than pure capital. Cash is what keeps the machine running. However, Mintage doesnt just take the money no questions asked. They delegate it based on the results of which coins their AI bots predict will be most profitable through their hyper-intelligent market analysis. Consider the AI tech an ace up Mintages sleeve. The money you give Mintage is used to purchase "hashpower" (computing power) in various mining pools. In Mintage's system, each "mining unit", or "hashpower unit" as they are also called, is equivelant to $1 USD. Each user will get a certain return per mining unit each week based on Mintage's performance for that week.For the end user, this makes the Mintage system remarkably transparent and easy to understand. Moreover, Mintage is able to change up which coins they focus onevery week. Remember, they dont handle the backend of mining. They simply provide capital to mining pools they want ot work with. So, what this means is, Mintage is able to zero in on the money without hurting anyones feelings. They are not invested in one type of hardware or one type of coin. They are invested in following the most profitable mining trends based on what the market needs. And they have a hyper-efficient system using artificial intelligence to help them do it.

HOW IS THE CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE WITH MINTAGE MINING?

On top of the exceptional quality of the platform, Mintage Mining also excels as a company to work with. Lets be honest, with the unregulated nature of the cryptocurrency markets, there are a huge number of scams out there. Further, there is almost no recourse if you fall victim to one. This is one reason why it is extremely important to research the company you are considering going with; the responsibility as to how things go will lie with you and you alone. So, that said, let us layout some reasons why we are happy with our experience as customers of Mintage Mining thus far:
  • they are very forward and transparent about their activity:this point is crucial. If a mining operation is not transparent about previous results, their hashpower and other factors concerning the concrete metrics of their operation it is the equivalent of investing in a construction company that cannot show you a single example of their work. With Mintage mining, the numbers add up. And so do the results. Their mining results are posted weekly on their website and no membership is necessary to view them. They also give a breakdown of the distribution of their hashpower as to which coins they will be focusing on in the coming week of mining. Mintage uses AI to determine which coins will be most profitable to mine based on trends in the market that only a computer or very experienced trader could detect.
  • they pay weekly dividends into a personal wallet:Mintage mining will pay a weekly dividend into each customers wallet (which they provide in you account) on a weekly basis. This is paid out in Bitcoin and is transferrable out of your wallet or back into a 1 or 3 year contract with Mintage. Payments are based on the amount of Bitcoin distributed into your wallet (the percentage you get per mining unit as your weekly payout) times the price of Bitcoin in USD at the time of deposit (weekly BTC payout x current BTC price in BTC = your weekly payment in USD). It's a lot simpler than it sounds.
  • Let's keep the numbers easy and round for the sake of this example. Let's say the price of Bitcoin at the time of your deposit is $10,000 USD and you put exactly $1,000 USD (0.1 Bitcoin or 1,000 mining/hashpower units into a 1 year Mintage Mining contract). At the end of your first week, Mintage delivers a 2% return through their mining network. You would get 2% per active unit which would equal $20 USD or 0.002 Bitcoin.

0.002 X 10,000 = $20 USD

Not bad for simply leaving your money in a mining contract. The amazing part is you can either withdraw your 0.002BTC/20USD or put it back into a mining contract on top of your oOf course, results will vary but this kind of opportunity is quite rare in the world of cryptocurrency mining offers. Oftentimes, internal fees and the chopping up of revenue will decimate what ends up in your account. Mintage keeps it straight and posts all of their date concerning results along with the math to support it.
  • they have excellent customer service:this is also a crucial element. And not just in cryptocurrency mining of course. There is nothing more frustrating than contacting a company only to hear nothing back; especially if you have funds invested. With Mintage Mining, the average turnaround time for an email response has been less than 24 hours. This tells you that A) they care about the customer experience and B) are doing well enough in their operations to have staff on hand to field inquiries. This may not seem like that big of a deal but you would be surprised how lacking customer s
  • they target different coins based on current trends in the markets:in a market subject to fluctuations as much as cryptocurrencies are, a coin that is profitable one day may not be so the next. Mintage mining uses AI to target trends in the market to project which coins will be most profitable in the coming week of mining. What this means is that their contracts will behighly targetedensuring a more than fare chance that your returns will be optimized. Further, they publicly post (no membership required) the coins to be mined in their upcoming contract. That is, you can see which coins the company is going to go for ahead of time. This is extremely valuable information to have.
  • they are fully compliant with US law (among other countries):remember that part about the world of cryptocurrencies being rife with scams? Well, Mintage Mining isnt one of them. The United States is one of the strictest countries in the world when it comes to cryptocurrencies. And Mintage Mining is fully accessible and legit for US citizens. This may not seem like much at first but, if you take a look at the new out there and what has happened to those less cautious with their funds, this is an amazingly stable and legit opportunity.

HOW MINTAGE MINING WORKS

Its a pretty straightforward system. Basically, you: Register an account: going through Mintage Mining directly will mean paying $500 USD to open an account. BUT, if you go through their partnership offer with NUI Social (another amazing cryptocurrency platform) you can join Mintage for free. Make your deposit into the weekly bucket:Mintage offers their mining unit purchase using a "bucket system". Each bucket has 500,000 units available or roughly $500,000 USD. The remaining availability for each weekly bucket is posted on their homepage along with what coins will be mined. Once Thursday of the next week comes or the bucket reaches 100% capacity (whichever comes first) that bucket will close and all mining units will be locked in for one year. Each mining unit is the equivalent of $1 USD which makes the system very easy to understand and work with. Wait for your results:Each week on Wednesday you will receive a percentage of the mining results per unit in your deposit. One unit equals approximately one US dollar. You will receive an email notifying you of the deposit into your account. You are free to either withdraw your payout or (HIGHLY RECOMMENDED) repurchase another 1-year contract with it. Recently, Mintage has begun displaying their weekly results in cents instead of percentages. Take the example below: in one week Mintage is able to pay out 2.5% or 2.5 cents ($ 0.025 USD) per mining unit you have 1000 units active in your contract 1000 x .025 = 25 new units for that week (you have made $25 USD for simply leaving your BTC on Mintage's mining platform). your payout will appear in the BTC wallet which Mintage provides in your account. The balance will display in both Bitcoin and United States Dollars (BTC and USD respectively). The dollar Repeat:if you really want to see growth in your Mintage holdings, you would be well advised to deposit your weekly payouts back into a new 1-year contract. This makes the difference between A) a mining platform giving you a few bucks a week to play with or B) it turning into a serious investment over time. Here is the reason why: each time you add your weekly payout back into a new 1-year contract, it will be added to all other mining units you have contracted with Mintage. Yes, your mining units generate compound interestin Bitcoin. Take the example below which, for the sake of simplicity, assumes a constant 2.5% return everyweek. Actual returns may vary and can be considerably less or considerably more than the 2.5% we use for the sake of example:

We really believe in what Mintage is providing. Of course we recommend you do your due dilligence before making your decision. But we think you will be impressed by your results if you do decide to join. They are providing a solid opportunity in a market that is really only just beginning. The potential of what could come to the cryptocurrency mining market in the years to come is difficult to make an accurate estimate about. However, there never really has been an opportunity quite like this. The chances are that, if you get involved now you will be glad you did.

What we like the most about Mintage is their low buy in limit: $25 USD. Yes, we do recommend putting in more if you can as your gains will compound far more quickly.

 

So, with that, thank you for reading and we hope to hear from you soon.

LEARN MORE:

If you would like to know more about Mintage Mining, please contact us. A real human will get back to you (usually within less than 48 hours) and we can go over the details of how the system works, results we have seen and the process of signing up. It's really not that difficult and, once your units are active in the hashpower batch it's actually kind of exciting to see your results every week.

item.title: BITCOIN BUILDIFY
item.dc:creator: Trevor272
item.content:encoded:
[et_pb_section fb_built="1" background_color="#000000" _builder_version="3.0.89" border_width_all="4px" border_color_all="#e09900" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

BITCOIN BUILDIFY: making crypto easy.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="21px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"][/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" specialty="on" _builder_version="3.0.89" border_color_bottom="#e09900" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_column type="2_3" specialty_columns="2" _builder_version="3.0.47"][et_pb_row_inner custom_padding="45px|0px|29.6875px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column_inner type="4_4" saved_specialty_column_type="2_3" _builder_version="3.0.47" box_shadow_position="outer" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

Are you curious about cryptocurrencies?

 

Do you want to know more about them?

 

Do you want to make money with them?

 

Then this is the website for you.

 

WHAT WE OFFER

  • information for those curious about the world of cryptocurrency. As this type of technology is still so new, the potential for information overload is very real. Hover over the "what is cryptocurrency" section in the main menu above to see our categories or visit our blog. We are also involved in building a community of legit cryptocurrency enthusiasts and promoters for the companies we work with. Join our mailing list to stay in touch.
  • products and services to help you leverage your crypto holdings via the following methods:
Mining platforms and mining pools:a service to help you get involved in mining different cryptocurrencies at different levels of involvement and investment. You can start with our recommended mining platform for as little as $10 after paying the initial $125 activation fee. Or, if you want to get really close to the action, you can go all out and get your own mining rig and join our recommended mining pool. Yes, it will cost more but the returns should more than make up for that. Mining projects are a good option for someone who either wants to diversify their cryptocurrency portfolio or simply get more involved with the "backend", so to speak, of the cryptocurrency world. Click here to learn more. Automated trading "bot" software: a service where you lease automated trading software and plug it into a compatible exchange to leverage the rise and fall of different cryptocurrencies on the market. This option buffers some of the risk of trading on the exchanges as the "bots" are able to react to the market and execute or hold trades in fractions of a second. They can also sense and move on trends your average beginning trader would never see. This is an excellent option for someone looking to have control over their cryptocurrency trading and investments but still mitigate risk. Click here to learn more.  

WHY "CRYPTOS"?

The truth is, cryptocurrency is creating a revolution. And this revolution is only beginning. Also, it is a revolution the likes of which has never been seen before. You may ask "what kind of revolution is happening"? Well, perhaps the easiest comparison to make would be to say that cryptocurrency is promising to do for both finance and information technology what the internet has done for communication and access to information. Actually, the parallels between the rise of the internet and the rise of cryptocurrency are striking. So striking, in fact, that some actually refer to the cryptocurrency revolution with such terms as "the next internet", "the second internet", "internet 2.0" and so on. True, the fundamental nature and capacity of the internet and cryptocurrency are quite different, but the potential they offer in terms of global reach, access, and ease of transfer are undeniably similar. [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column_inner][/et_pb_row_inner][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type="1_3" _builder_version="3.0.47"][et_pb_sidebar area="sidebar-1" show_border="off" _builder_version="3.0.89" header_font="||||||||" body_font="||||||||" background_color="#ffffff" text_shadow_style="preset5"][/et_pb_sidebar][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="3px|0px|2px|0px"][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|2px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="20.75px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

FURTHER THOUGHTS

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" specialty="on" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_column type="3_4" specialty_columns="3" _builder_version="3.0.47"][et_pb_row_inner custom_padding="0px|0px|29.6875px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column_inner type="4_4" saved_specialty_column_type="3_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" box_shadow_position="outer" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"] So, what's the big deal with crypto currency? First, if you don't know much about what cryptocurrency is, we recommend clicking here to take a look at our "What Is Cryptocurrency" link on the menu at the top of the page. It should give you some useful insight into the background of cryptocurrencies and a good working knowledge of where they stand today. If you're already "in the loop", so to speak, but wondering how these technologies can be considered revolutionary consider the following: cryptocurrencies bring the security, global reach and accessibility of the biggest financial institutions on the planet to the individual minus the institution. Think of that for a moment. Imagine if you could send money to who you want to send it, pay who you want to pay directly without the intermedium of a bank or institution. To those of us in the first world, this may not seem a very big deal. That's because we're used to the convenience and accessability of banks and the services they provide. To the rest of the world, which is A LOT of people, this concept is revolutionary. It means you can transact with anyone anywhere on the planet and all you need to do it is an internet connection. Cryptocurrencies do away with the inherent corruption, duplicity and forced control of institutions and bring command back to the user. They are a truly egalitarian, secure and simply amazing technology. Aside from this, there is also a high degree of different uses and inspiration behind each cryptocurrency. The grand daddy of them all is Bitcoin which, according to the original whitepaper, was intended originally as a means of purely online transaction; a kind of "internet money". But, given the limited supply and increasing cost of mining, Bitcoin is slowly but surely changing into more of a store of value instead of a means of everyday transaction; that is a kind of "internet gold" instead of an "internet money". In its place, as demand for similar mediums with a higher capacity, lower transaction cost and more potential for integration with other technologies has grown, there has arisen a huge array of what are generally termed "alt coins" i.e. those cryptocurrencies other than Bitcoin. These socalled "alt coins" can be designed with a range of uses. Some, like Ethereum function as an improvement over Bitcoin with much the same intended use in mind. Others may pursue a single, highly specialized objective not necessarily related only to the transfer of monetary funds. Take for example, DASH, which is designed solely to support the buying and selling of cellular air time on the African continent. Or SALT which is designed to allow holders of cryptocurrency to take out loans against their holdings without giving them up so long as all funds due are returned within the contracted time. There are even ICO's (initial coin offerings) for individual companies which function almost as stocks would only their crypto coins may be traded on the open market. Indeed, they are a new thing, these cryptocurrencies, but it is more than certain that they are here to stay and that this is only the beginning of what's to come. They are only growingday by day, month by month and year by year. No one really knows how much cryptocurrency is going to change the world but we know the change is coming. So, with that said, thank you for visiting. We wish you the best in your crypto journey and are here to help. Whether you want to just learn more about what cryptocurrency is or if you want to get involved and are curious about what kind of product or service to go with, we can help you. [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column_inner][/et_pb_row_inner][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type="1_4" _builder_version="3.0.47"][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_section]

Crypto made easy. Useful information for the crypto curious minus the cheesy marketing. Our info is clear and our recommended platforms legit.

item.title: WHAT IS CRYPTOCURRENCY?
item.dc:creator: Trevor272
item.content:encoded:
[et_pb_section fb_built="1" background_color="#000000" _builder_version="3.0.89" border_width_all="5px" border_color_all="#e09900" custom_padding="0px|0px|10px|0px"][et_pb_row _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

What is cryptocurrency?

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="21px|0px|7px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

WHAT IT IS

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="2px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

Cryptocurrency is a general term for a digital medium that is capable of moving either funds or information (sometimes both) to basically anywhere on the planet with an internet connection; without reliance on a trusted 3rd party. Although no physical tranfer of a material occurs, crypto currencies "move" on the blockchain where the transactions is stored in an immutable form free for all to see.

Cryptocurrencies exist only digitally and, as of yet, have no physical or cash correspondent as most traditional currencies do. They are often referred to as tokens or coins but this is really just an arbitrary designation given to a discrete unit of digital information based on peoples' ingrained thinking toward currency. There may be some similarities between cryptocurrencies and what is held on the computers of banks and financial institutions as "cash in digital form" but they are hardly ever more than surface deep. The term crypto, although not the most accurate, refers to how the majority of cryptocurrencies are encrypted/embedded into the blockchain (the network on which they move about). This means that their every movement is made both highly known and secure; although, to a large degree, the end-users on each transaction remain anonymous. The addition of the term currency probably stems from the fact that the original cryptocurrency, Bitcoin, was intended to be a purely peer-to-peer version of electronic cash with which individuals could make financial transactions without relying on a "trusted 3rd party". (See the original Whitepaper here). This deceptively simple idea carries enormous implications for the future of finance and technology.

The oldest and most well known cryptocurrency is Bitcoin (BTC) which debuted on January 3rdof 2009. Generally speaking, any other cryptocurrency than Bitcoin is labelled as an "Alt Coin" meaning "alternative coin". Currently there are upwards of 1500 different Alt Coins in circulation and potentially many more to come in the future.There is considerable variation among alt coins in regard to their fundamental structures and transactionability. So it is advised to do your due dilligence on any coin you may be interested in as no two cryptos seem to be the same.

Indeed, the explosive proliferation of cryptocurrencies in recent years has been compared to the dot com boom of the 90s and early 2000s; and to many historic economic bubbles before that. To add to the parallel, the new technological paradigm that cryptocurrencies represent has also been said to have the potential for the same type of impact the rise of the internet has had. That is, the cryptocurrency model may represent a revolution in technology no less important and world changing than the internet has been since its public launch in the early 90s. There are those who refer to cryptocurrencies as the next internet or internet 2.0.It remains to be seen when and how cryptocurrency will see mainstream adoption and what effect this will have on humanity. It is fairly certain, however, that cryptocurrencies are here to stay and we are still only at the beginning of their rise into mainstream adoption and everyday use.

 

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.89" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_video src="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bBC-nXj3Ng4" image_src="http://bitcoinbuildify.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/how-cryptocurrencies-work-video-cover.jpg" play_icon_color="#e09900" _builder_version="3.0.89" max_width="67%" module_alignment="center" box_shadow_style="preset2"][/et_pb_video][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|19px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

WHERE THEY STAND

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

As it is today, cryptocurrencies exist in an unregulated kind of gray zone; at least as far as the big financial institutions and governments of the world are concerned. They are not officially recognized as currencies per se, but have seen an enormous rise in interest and popularity among an increasing number of people who recognize their potential. There is still some debate among the global community and certain regulatory bodies alike as to how they should be classified, For the time being, cryptocurrencies can best be thought of as something like a combination of a security and a stock in a company. However, speaking truly, they occupy their own unique, and as yet, unprecedented category. They are very much the type of technology that, like the internet, will likely end up forcing the world to adapt to it rather than them adapting to the world.

Despite the difficulty in accepting or even accurately categorizing cryptocurrencies,it is widely believed that,given their amazing potential and amassing popular momentum, their eventual mainstream adoption is only a matter of time. That is,cryptocurrencies will simply have to become mainstream eventually. It is very much a case of a technology being too good to ignore. Much like the smartphone over the cell phone or the internet over the telephone. Historically, no one way of doing things has ever won the battle of convenience and common sense against tradition and what people have been used to

 

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

HOW DID CRYPTOCURRENCIES START?

 

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

As stated above, the original cryptocurrency is Bitcoin which debuted in January of 2009. However, there had been interest in the creation of a purely digital currency from much earlier times. Bitcoin was the first successful attempt at such a thing because it solved, with brilliant simplicity, the "double spending problem". The double spending problem was an issue unique to digital objects because they can be duplicated infinitely and with such perfection that a copy is indistinguishable from the original. This works very well in the case of music, video and other media files; not so much in the case of money. If a digital currency were unable to overcome the double spending problem it would be impossible for it to retain any value or use as a currency whatsoever at all. This is because, given the nature of greed combined with completely perfect duplication, such a currency would almost immediately fall victim to infinite inflation. What made Bitcoin unique was its introduction and use of blockchain technology. Blockchain technology is essentially a distributed ledger to which all members have access yet no one single member has control. What this means is that, once initiated, a transaction cannot be tampered with in anyway because it must be verified by all members on the blockchain. Two crucial elements of this involve 1) time-stamping which fixes the initiation of the transaction to a fixed an unalterable time and 2) "hashing" (encoding of) the transaction into a random string of letters and numbers that is unique to that transaction alone. This simple yet foolproof technology sparked a very quiet yet tremendously powerful technology that is really only now, nearly a decade later, making its presence known.

 

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_video src="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lx9zgZCMqXE" image_src="http://bitcoinbuildify.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/how-the-blockchain-works-video-cover.jpg" play_icon_color="#e09900" _builder_version="3.0.89" max_width="71%" module_alignment="center" box_shadow_style="preset2"][/et_pb_video][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

Despite it being an entirely artificial construction that exists only in digital form, the beginnings of Bitcoin are admittedly mysterious. The story goes that a man by the name of Satoshi Nakamoto built the Bitcoin technology and, shortly after, disappeared. No one has ever come forward to publicly announce his identity. Nor is anyone sure if Mr. Nakamoto is an individual, a group or perhaps an agency. Whatever the case may be, the timing and nature of Bitcoin's introduction struck a chord from the getgo.

If you will recall, January 2009 (the time of Bitcoin's debut) was not only the start of a new year but a time immediately following the greatest and most devestating economic crash in generations. In fact, there is probably no other time at which it would have been more fit to bring Bitcoin onto the market.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|19px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

ARE CRYPTOCURRENCIES MONEY?

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|54px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|27px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

Although the term "currency" may limit one's impression of cryptocurrencies to simple financial transactions there is actually a wide variety of different types of cryptocurrencies with a huge variety of intended uses; almost none of which are the same. Some are designed purely to support financial transactions. Others to facilitate the secure transfer of information via smart contracts . Some are limited to a very narrow spectrum of uses while others are almost unlimited. Some, like Ripple (XRP), are highly centralized while others like Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) are completely decentralized. There are even some cryptocurrencies like Bitqy (BQ) which are the creation of a single company seeking to build value in their coin via their networking efforts and special offers with other companies. A common trend is that a need will either be identified or presumed to exist and a cryptocurrency will be designed to serve it. This makes the nature of cryptocurrency markets a very interesting one, indeed. It is quite difficult to imagine any other frontier where such a combination of technology and creativity is converging quite so strongly.

Most cryptocurrencies do retain some monetary value tradeable on the exchanges so it is not true to say they don't. However, many of them are almost like a currency/stock hybrid in that they represent not only an assigned monetary value but also a unique function built in to them by the team that designed them. Even this comparison, however, is not quite accurate as cryptocurrencies do not fit the same profile as stock in a company either. They are truly an entirely new commodity the likes of which has never been seen before. Further, there currently doesnt seem to be a limit for the different uses and purposes a cryptocurrency can be designed for. And here, in 2018, it must be admitted that there is a kind of free for all mentality concerning the cryptocurrency market as they are a technology that is both extremely new and unproven while showing tremendous potential. It is not yet quite clear what needs will be met and what trends will truly take off over others in the future of the crypto world. It is widely assumed, however, just given the sheer numbers that things are most definitely afoot in terms of the development and adoption of these technologies and going back to the world before cryptocurrency seems increasingly unlikely. So, the comparison to the dot com bubble is definitely an apt one.

However, in spite of this bandwagon mentality reminiscent of other, historical "bubbles" with its overtones of clamoring for market share and whatnot it is also a time of tremendouspotential forboth technological innovation and, if you know where to look, considerable financial opportunity.It will also likely prove to be the beginning of a new and exciting addition to the technology of the 21stcentury. Only time will tell, however, which cryptocurrencies will last and which will not.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|19px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

THE GOOD

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="3px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="3px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

So, now on to what makes cryptocurrencies unique and why they are becoming so overwhelmingly popular.

Generally speaking, the reason cryptocurrencies show such potential is that transactions with them are :

  • Extremely fast:A typical international transfer made with a bank may take up to a week and involve sometimes numerous fees along the way. With a typical cryptocurrency transaction, it generally takes from 1 to 30 minutes and there will only be a single fee, if any. There are cases, however, when the network is particularly busy when a transaction may take several days. At these times, transaction fees may temporarily rise. However, this is still far faster and cheaper than other methods. Newer cryptocurrency and network models are only making things faster and simpler as the technology improves.
  • Made from peer to peer:As it is today, almost all transfers involve a 3rd party service. This may come in the form of a bank, a credit card company or a service like PayPal. There is nothing particularly wrong with this but it does have some drawbacks. First and foremost is a lack of security. It may not be widely publicized but such companies and services are the relentless targets of fraud, hacking and other criminal attempts at access. They spend huge amounts of money to maintain security and loss prevention and they are not always successful. There is therefore no way for them to avoid charging fees and causing endless inconveniences simply for either holding your money or moving it for you. Despite their popularity, the banking system is tremendously inefficient and outdated. Further, the general lack of control and free access to your funds in a bank is done away with in using crypto currencies. Your funds are yours and may be transferred, deposited and stored as easily as photos on an email. While in the bank, your funds are not truly yours and your access to them may be severely delayed or denied altogether based on the whims of whatever institution is holding them. You will also likely be paying considerable fees for often bizarre and arbitrary reasons about which you can do nothing.
  • Far cheaper than almost any other service out there: Because the majority of cryptocurrency transactions will take place via a decentralized, digital network, they are not only faster and more efficient than other 3rdparty services they are also often significantly cheaper. This means that not only are the fees far lower, but that there will be only one and so far more of your amount transferred will reach its final destination.
  • Divisible into amounts far smaller than banks or other payment services will allow: Exact amounts vary depending on the level of traffic on the network but it is generally true that the minimum transaction amount in a cryptocurrency transaction is far less than that in a transaction involving a cash card or bank transfer. For example, the standard minimum transaction for a bank card is generally around $10 while, on January 18, 2018 the minimum transaction amount of Bitcoin (BTC) was $0.06 (0.00000547BTC at exchanges rates current with the time).
  • More secure than traditional transaction platforms:provided you don't leave your holdings on a public exchange or share your access keys irresponsibly, you will find interactions with cryptocurrency to behighly secure. No third party is involved in cryptocurrency transactions so there is no need for concern regarding corruption or embezzlement etc of funds. And, if you take the extra step of getting a hardware wallet, you will also eliminate any fear of even the most skilled hacker accessing your funds.
  • Highly autonomous: One of the main tenets of the Bitcoin Whitepaper (after which a good number of other cryptocurrency "whitepapers" have followed" was the notion of keeping transactions strictly peer to peer; that is limiting the involvement of the transaction and its associated details purely to those involved. This 1) decreases risk 2) increases security 3) increases efficiency and 4) protects privacy as much as possible. This kind of autonomy is something that simply cannot be equalled by any 3rd party financial service provider today.

As you can see from the list above the advantages of cryptocurrencies are difficult to ignore, to say the least. The potential for streamlining finance and, subsequently, the immense industry generally referred to as *"the supply chain" upon which it depends cannot be underestimated. There is, indeed, tremendous potential in crypto currencies. Conversely, however, as with any new technology there is a certain level of mistrust and suspicion; a kind of doubt toward something which challenges the validity of the status quo. And so...

 

*the supply chain can best be thought of as all of the industry and commerce involved in the process of converting natural resources (minerals, coal, timber, oil, metals etc.) into finished products and then selling them to customers. It is estimated that some 80% of all economic activity in the world is dependent or somehow a part of this.

In closing, I would like to make clear that, although cryptocurrencies do offer a means of financial transaction there is far more potential to the technology than that. Indeed, there are some that argue that the real genius of cryptocurrencies as precedented by Bitcoin, is the blockchain technology underlying them. To learn more about that, I recommend our blog post devoted to the subject. It is a fascinating read and should give you valuable insight into the essential nature of the underlying platform behind the majority of the many ICO's and similar projects seemingly coming out of the woodwork by the day.

It is worth noting, however, that although cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology are essentially different technologies there are crucial and over-arching areas of crossover. So much so, in fact, that it is mostly true that what applies to blockchain applies to cryptocurrency. BUT, since the technology is applicable to far, far more than simply the financial industry the potential for leverage and mass application across a huge variety of industries cannot be understated.

Happy Crypto'ing. :-)

 

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="27px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"][/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="2px|0px|54px|0px"][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" background_image="http://bitcoinbuildify.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/2018-02-19_15h11_51.png" border_color_all="#000000"][et_pb_row _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.47" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]

item.title: WHAT IS CRYPTOCURRENCY MINING?
item.dc:creator: Trevor272
item.content:encoded:
[et_pb_section bb_built="1" background_color="#000000" _builder_version="3.0.89" border_width_all="6px" border_color_all="#e09900" custom_padding="3px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

CRYPTOCURRENCY MINING

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="32px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="3px|0px|2px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

WHAT IS IT?

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="6px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="3px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89" background_layout="light"] "Mining", in the world of cryptocurrencies, is an analogous term for the process of using computational power in order to do two things: 1) decode and therefore unlock new crypto currencies from the matrix in which they are "buried". 2) verify transactions on the blockchain for certain cryptocurrencies in order to allow users of the given blockchain to send and receive funds. Very often, these two processes are one and the same. And they tend to fuel both demand and incentive for the currency being mined. In crypto-mining, the heavy machines and explosives used in something like the actual, physical mining of gold are replaced by raw computational power. There are several methods through which a "miner" (whoever is running the computer(s)) may "mine" cryptocurrencies. To date, the two most common are "proof of work" (POW) and "proof of stake" (POS) respectively. Proof of work was the original mining model and is the system used by the Bitcoin blockchain. Proof of stake is employed by the Ethereum blockchain. The details of the actual mining process can get rather technical in a hurry. However, the general rule is: the higher hashrate, the better. Hashrate being the speed at which a computer is able to essentially guess incredibly complex series of numbers until it gets it right. These incredibly complex series of numbers are known as a hash. And it is simply a random series of numbers and letters encoded in a one way process that basically functions as a puzzle for miners on the blockchain to decipher and verify as quickly as possible. So, essentially, cryptocurrency mining boils down to the process of a computer solving a complex puzzle. Each time a "puzzle" is solved, the first "miner" to solve it receives an award in the form of an amount of currency from whatever blockchain they are working on and the transaction is able to be completed. This is what both creates the incentive for people to participate in the blockchain and what eliminates the need for a single "trusted 3rd party" through which all transactions must pass. All miners particpate democratically in the process and the Bitcoin (or any other cryptocurrency being mined) is never exclusively in any one miner's hands. Nor do they have any real access to the details of the transaction. We recommend you read the original Bitcoin Whitepaper in order to get a better grasp of how this process works. It is rather technical but well worth your time if you are interested in this kind of technology and opportunity. [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

WHY CREATE AN ARTIFICAL MINING SYSTEM?

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"] Cryptocurrency mining is a simple and ingenius way to both control the availability (maintain scarcity) of and to stimulate interest in a given cryptocurrency. This entirely artificial simulation of actual, phsyical mining serves three main purposes: 1) to draw in, via monetary incentive, a community of individuals with the requisite skills and technology to support the cryptocurrency's network 2) to generate use and thereby assign value to the crypto currency. Theoretically the energy, time and funds expended in extracting a coin will impart a certain level of value for the cryptocurrency being mined just as it would with an actual mineral mined from the earth. 3) to maintain scarcity of the coin and thereby strike a dynamic balance between supply and demand for the given cryptocurrency. The two factors of scarcity on the one hand and need/use on the other have historically been what makes any currency valuable. Further, supply and demand combined with the third factor of competition are extremely strong driving factors in any economic system. The implementation of a cryptocurrency mining system seeks to simulate this situation as literally as possible. In the purely physical world, a good example of this is gold. Gold can only be aquired through extreme effort that works out to a very small, yet surprisingly consistent amount of new gold being introduced per year. Because gold has historically been assigned immense value through it's use and because the available supply is limited and not very easily increased it tends to retain a very high value; regardless of world events and trends. This is exactly the thinking behind the implementation of cryptocurrency "mining". As artificial a process as crypto-mining may be, it has been extremely successful in its goal of simulating the historic trends and environments which have allowed more traditional currencies (most notably gold) to thrive. The analogy of computers "mining" through the "earth" of extremely complex computational problems to unlock the "gold" of the sought cryptocurrency is a correlation that is nearly as literal as can be. Further, the simplicity and ingenious nature of this system has seen exponential growth and investment in recent years. As the popularity and use of cryptocurrencies has increased, there has been a corresponding rise in the competitiveness of the crypto mining industry. In fact, crypto mining is now a multi-million dollar industry. It also has come to require a huge amount of capital, skill and specialized equipment to run if anything approaching profitibability is desired. In the early days of Bitcoin, when mining was pursued more as a hobby among tech enthusiasts, it was possible to mine Bitcoin with nothing more than the CPU on your laptop. Bitcoin mining, for those who had ever even heard of it, was largely viewed as "just one of those onlne things" and little more. Those days are, unfortunately, long gone. As cryptocurrencies have slowly but steadily gained in popularity there has been a corresponding rise in the number and size of mining operations. It is now an extremely competitive and increasingly difficult venture to take part in. Large firms with correspondingly large investments backing them have gradually come to dominate the scene; this is especially true of the larger and more expensive coins of which the "grandaddy", so to speak, is Bitcoin. However,of the 1547 different cryptocurrencies currently listed on the crypto authority site coinmarketcap.com 621, or roughly 40%, are listed as mineable. A crypto-currency being mineable or unmineable can have a significant impact on its public perception and, by default, its market value. So, although the good old days of Bitcoin mining on your laptop may be gone, there are likely many, many more developments and opportunities to come in the wider world of cryptocurrency mining. [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="1px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="27px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

Bitcoin Hasharate Graph Jan '09 to Feb '18

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|8px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_image src="http://bitcoinbuildify.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/hashrate-graph-2009-2018-1-e1519304430650.jpg" _builder_version="3.0.89" border_width_all="2px" border_color_all="#0dbde0"] [/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|3px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|27px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

The image above shows the progression of hashrate (computational speed) increase from January 2009 to late February 2018. The numbers on the left represent how many TH/s (trillion hashes per second) were required at the given time of mining. In the early days, nothing more than a decent laptop was necessary. Today a serious Bitcoin mining operation requires literally a warehouse full of hyper-specialized computers working in unison 24/7. Mining is getting more and more competitive all the time. Although, for the majority of us, starting a successful Bitcoin mining operation from the ground up is essentially out of reach there are, fortunately, a large number of options out there. There are also an increasingly large number of coins to be mined.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="8px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="3px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

CAN YOU STILL GET INVOLVED?

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="5px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|27px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"] YES. Despite the exponential rise in the cost and competitiveness of crypto-mining, a number of options designed to recruit capital, computational power or both have become available to the public. Generally speaking, if you are interested in getting involved in crypto-mining, no technical knowledge is necessary. Although you will likely be able to tell which offers are legit and which aren't if you do your research and familiarize yourself with the basics of the industry. Unfortunately, just as with some of the Alt Coins, the longevity of the project, legitimacy of the company and, sometimes, even the legality of the operation itself is questionable. It is therefore advised to always thoroughly investigate a mining project's background as thoroughly as possible before joining. Fortunately, however, with the majority of mining ventures the risk is considerably lower than the trading of cryptocurrencies on the exchanges. So, if you are able to find a good mining project or "mining pool", as they are often referred to, your returns should very likely be consistent. If you actually invest in mining equipment, you can usually expect higher returns than you would in just investing capital. So, to be brief, although costs and competitions have increased YES you can still make money in crypto-mining. [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="3px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

CRYPTOCURRENCY MINING OPTIONS

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="22.3281px|0px|22px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"] There are a plethora of mining projects out there these days. Some reputable, some less so. However, they will generally fall into two different groups:

1 Mining platforms: groups that need funding. This type of operation may also be referred to as "cloud mining".

2 Mining pools: groups that need hardware and computational power

Both types of operations may be thought of as a co-op in that resources, whether funding or hardware, are pooled together toward a common goal. However, the start-up costs, time investment and potential for returns are generally quite different. [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="1px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="3px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

MINING PLATFORMS

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"] A mining platform, or cloud mining operation, is an organization that seeks funding from its customers in order to maintain operations. Mining platforms are typically the easiest mining operations to get involved with as particpants need only devote money to the project, not technical skill. No extra time or equipment is necessary. The specific figures and policies will vary considerably with these types of operations. But, generally, an initial fee will be required to activate your account. This can range from as little as $100 to upwards of several thousand dollars. This activation fee may be either a one time or yearly fee. Once the initial activation/license fee is paid, you will then be able to pay whatever you feel comfortable with into the mining platform itself. This initial deposit will often be contractually "locked in" for a period of anywhere from a few months to a few years. It will then give returns at fixed intervals (anywhere from weekly to monthly) based on the amount you deposited. Mining platforms will offer one of two options to pursue with your deposit 1) buying share or "units" in the mining operation and 2) leasing hardware or server space. Option one is by far the easiest and often the cheapest way to go. Option two, though often more costly than option one, does carry the potential for higher returns as you will be more directly involved in the mining operation. Paying in to a mining platform is a very hands free and low risk way to get involved in cryptocurrency mining. However, activations fees and return percentages can vary wildly so it is really best to do your research before buying in. Below are some points to consider during your research:
  • the amount you have to invest:this point is true of any investment so doesn't need a lot of elaboration. A point to remember, though, is that a number of mining pools will only conduct transactions in cryptocurrencies; very often Bitcoin. This means that if you have some Bitcoin or some other cryptocurrency you're not sure what to do with, putting it into a mining pool may not be a bad idea.
  • the type or types of cryptocurrency the pool will be mining:obviously, the higher the value of the coin being mined, the greater the potential for your returns. Increasingly, more and more mining operations will pursue several different cryptocurrencies at once. In fact, they may even change which cryptocurrencies they pursue on a weekly or monthly basis based on market projections and presumed profitability. It is not advised to join an operation that pursues only one single coin. This goes directly against the age old rule of never putting all of your eggs in one basket.
  • the formula the pool uses to determine your payouts:suffice to say some mining operations are more generous to their customers than others. Be sure to know the actual math behind how your payouts are determined before giving them your money. There can be a lot of variance here and, since very often your deposits will be locked in for an inconvenienty long amount of time, the last thing you want is to find a much better offer after having already paid into something else.
  • the amount of cryptocurrency the pool is able to mine:forumulas aside, if the mining operation you go with is still in its early phases, you may not get the kind of returns you would elsewhere. A good point of advice is to check for records of previous mining results. A good operation will make them public. In recent years a number of extremely large, well funded and aggressive mining operations have come about that have drastically increased the difficulty of mining.
  • how the cryptocurrency markets are faring at the time of mining:if the markets are down, chance are mining results will be as well. This may not necessarily be an indication of a mining pool's validity but it will most definitely affect your returns. This factor isn't actually as important as those listed above but should still be taken into consideration.
The general pattern is that, once you pay in to the mining pool, a percentage of your initial deposit will be repaid from the pools weekly or monthly mining results. The company we work with and personally recommend is Mintage Mining. Click here to learn more. [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_row _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_accordion _builder_version="3.0.89" background_color="#e02b20"] [/et_pb_accordion][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="3px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

MINING POOLS

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="9px|0px|19px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="2px|0px|20.75px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"] A mining pool will consist of a group that is directly involved with the hardware of the mining operation. That is, a mining pool is composed of the "miners" who run, maintain and, in some cases, build the equipment involved in the actual mining of the cryptocurrency in question. Generally speaking, buying into a mining pool will be significantly more expensive than buying into a mining platform. It will also require a higher degree of specialized knoweldge and skill as well as more of your time. However, the potential for higher returns is usually proportionately greater. There are still individuals who prefer to build their own "rigs" and to mine the blockchain themselves. However, cryptocurrency mining has become exponentially more difficult, expensive and competitive in recent years and it is increasingly difficult for small operations to make a profit. For some of the bigger coins, like Bitcoin, it may even be impossible. Hence, the recent rise in popularity of mining pools. In mining pools, instead of a percentage based on what you paid in, you will receive a percentage of what is actually mined. This is the same difference as that between a shareholder and a co-owner of the company (although specific dynamics may vary). In devoting your time and energy and assuming more of the risk and responsibility, you also receive more of the reward. [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="3px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

WHO WE WORK WITH

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="27px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_image src="http://bitcoinbuildify.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/2018-02-28_18h26_31.png" url="https://www.mintagemining.com/#page-top" url_new_window="on" align="center" _builder_version="3.0.89"] [/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_row _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_video src_webm="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NSdWOV2EbUw" play_icon_color="#e09900" _builder_version="3.0.89" border_width_all="3px" border_color_all="#e09900" box_shadow_style="preset2"] [/et_pb_video][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89" border_width_bottom="2px" border_color_bottom="#e09900"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

WHY MINTAGE MINING?

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="13px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|27px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"] Mintage Mining offers all of the elements that are desirable in a mining platform package with basically none of the elements that aren't. Instead of a mining pool, Mintage mining is a mining platform;. That is, they offer the ability for non-techies and non-miners to get involved in mining with none of the upfront investment in time, equipment or education. They are also able to coordinate with multiple mining pools and to leverage the best offers in a way that brings the most value to those who buy in to the weekly contracts. You could think of them as a brokerage which is able to coordinate among various offers and expertly negotiate the most profitable deals. They make the tough decisions, you simply give what you can to the operation. Essentially, mining pools need funding. Without it, they would soon go belly up. Mining is expensive.And it is becoming increasingly more so all the time.The electricity costs alone would put most people off the idea altogether. Then there are the added burdens of maintanance, skilled technicians and the sheer amount of time required to run a profitable mining operation. Think hovering over a warehouse full of computers 24/7 to ensure optimum functionality and profitability. All the while there is the risk of malfunction or systems going down altogether. Unless you have the technical skill and human capital to manage this type of situation, this is probably a risk you don't want to take. What Mintage is able to do is offer the mining pools it works with pure capital (Show me the money!). There is nothing a business with high overhead needs more than pure capital. Cash is what keeps the machine running. However, Mintage doesn't just hand over the money no questions asked. They delegate it based on the results of which coins their AI bots predict will be most profitable through their hyper-intelligent market analysis. Consider the AI tech an ace up Mintage's sleeve. Moreover, Mintage is able to change up which coins they focus on every week. Remember, they don't handle the backend of mining. They simply provide capital to mining pools they want ot work with. So, what this means is, Mintage is able to zero in on the money without hurting anyone's feelings. They are not invested in one type of hardware. They are not invested in one type of coins. They are invested in following the money. And they have a hyper-efficient system using artificial intelligence to help them do it. [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89" border_width_bottom="2px" border_color_bottom="#e09900"]

HOW IS THE CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE WITH MINTAGE MINING?

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" background_color="#ffffff" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_margin="|||" custom_padding="35px|0px|0px|0px" box_shadow_style="preset1"][et_pb_row custom_padding="2px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"] On top of the exceptional quality of the platform, Mintage Mining also excels as a company to work with. Let's be honest, with the unregulated nature of the cryptocurrency markets, there are a huge number of scams out there. Further, there is almost no recourse if you fall victime to one. This is one reason why it is extremely important to research the company you are considering going with; the responsibility as to how things go will lie with you and you alone. So, that said, let us layout some reasons why we are happy with our experience as customers of Mintage Mining thus far:
  • they are very forward and transparent about their activity: this point is crucial. If a mining operation is not transparent about previous results, their hashpower and other factors concerning the concrete metrics of their operation it is the equivalent of investing in a construction company that cannot show you a single example of their work. With Mintage mining, the numbers add up. And so do the results. Their mining results are posted weekly on their website and no membership is necessary to view them. They also give a breakdown of the distribution of their hashpower as to which coins they will be focusing on in the coming week of mining. Mintage uses AI to determine which coins will be most profitable to mine based on trends in the market that only a computer or very experienced trader could detect.
  • they pay weekly dividends into a personal wallet:Mintage mining will pay a weekly dividend into each customer's wallet on a weekly basis. This is paid out in Bitcoin and is transferrable out of your wallet or back into a contract with Mintage. Payments are based on the amount of Bitcoin distributed into your wallet times the price of Bitcoin at the time (weekly BTC payout X current BTC price = your weekly payment in USD). For example, let' say you receive0.10097083 Bitcoin (BTC) and the price of BTC at the time of deposit is USD $10,000. Your earnings would be:
 

0.10097083 X 10,000 = 1,009.7183USD

  Or, rounding up, about $1,009.72. Not bad for simply leaving your money in a mining contract. Of course, results will vary but this kind of opportunity is quite rare in the world of cryptocurrency mining offers. Oftentimes, "internal fees" and the chopping up of revenue will decimate what ends up in your account. Mintage keeps it straight and posts all of their date concerning results along with the math to support it.
  • they have excellent customer service:this is also a crucial element. And not just in cryptocurrency mining of course. There is nothing more frustrating than contacting a company only to hear nothing back; especially if you have funds invested. With Mintage Mining, the average turnaround time for an email response has been less than 24 hours. This tells you that A) they care about the customer experience and B) are doing well enough in their operations to have staff on hand to field inquiries. This may not seem like that big of a deal but you would be surprised how lacking customer s
  • they target different coins based on current trends in the markets: in a market subject to fluctuations as much as cryptocurrencies are, a coin that is profitable one day may not be so the next. Mintage mining uses AI to target trends in the market to project which coins will be most profitable in the coming week of mining. What this means is that their contracts will behighly targeted ensuring a more than fare chance that your returns will be optimized. Further, they publicly post (no membership required) the coins to be mined in their upcoming contract. That is, you can see which coins the company is going to go for ahead of time. This is extremely valuable information to have.
  • they are fully compliant with US law (among other countries):remember that part about the world of cryptocurrencies being rife with scams? Well, Mintage Mining isn't one of them. The United States is one of the strictest countries in the world when it comes to cryptocurrencies. And Mintage Mining is fully accessible and legit for US citizens. This may not seem like much at first but, if you take a look at the new out there and what has happened to those less cautious with their funds, this is an amazingly stable and legit opportunity.
[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px" box_shadow_style="preset1"][et_pb_row custom_padding="22px|0px|13px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89" border_width_bottom="2px" border_color_bottom="#e09900"]

HOW MINTAGE MINING WORKS

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="5px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89" background_layout="light"] It's a pretty straightforward system. Basically, you: Register an account Pay the activation fee Make your deposit into the weekly "bucket" Wait for your results If you're smart, deposit your weekly results back into the next bucket Repeat BUT, there's a catch! If you simply want to open an account with Mintage, there is a USD $500 annual fee. However, if you first join NUI Social for USD $125, opening an account with Mintage Mining is FREE. NUI Social is another amazing platform in itself. You can click hereto learn more about it.   [/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section bb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|54px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|27px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4"][et_pb_image src="http://bitcoinbuildify.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/2018-02-28_22h30_19.png" _builder_version="3.0.89" max_width="87%" module_alignment="center"] [/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]

item.title: WHAT IS CRYPTOCURRENCY TRADING?
item.dc:creator: Trevor272
item.content:encoded:
[et_pb_section fb_built="1" background_color="#000000" _builder_version="3.0.89" border_width_all="5px" border_color_all="#e09900" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="27px|0px|9px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.89" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

CRYPTOCURRENCY TRADING SOFTWARE

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.89" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"]

WHAT IS CRYPTOCURRENCY TRADING?

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="3.0.89" custom_padding="1px|0px|0px|0px"][et_pb_row custom_padding="0px|0px|0px|0px" _builder_version="3.0.89"][et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="3.0.89" parallax="off" parallax_method="on"][et_pb_text _builder_version="3.0.89"] Cryptocurrency trading means to trade one's cryptocurrency holdings against other coin types on a compatible exchange in order to make a profit. The price of coins can change dramatically on the cryptocurrency markets so there is a lot of opportunity to profit if you know what you are doing. However, if you don't know what you are doing, there is a strong chance you will lose your money; and lose it very quickly. Trading cryptocurrencies is essentially the same as trading stocks and bonds on Wall Street. The only fundamental difference is that the cryptocurrency markets are unregulated. There is no central authority governing the markets and there is also very little precedent for legal recourse or recompense for theft and fraud. There are strong arguments both for and against regulations in any financial market. On the one hand, regulations provides something of a safety net in that they tend to hem in fluctuations and to stabilize the system as a whole. Regulations also help to fight against fraud and the various types of scams and shams that will arise if there is no cohesive oversight. On the other hand, lack of regulation or "deregulation", as those who would like to see the rules go away refer to it, allows for much greater fluctuations and a higher amount of risk to be taken. This can lead to tremendous profit gains for those who know how to ride the trends but can also lead to equally tremendous and devestating losses for those who don't. This is particularly true in the current global financial system because the well-being of a huge portion of humanity is inextricably tied into it.
